message.content:
cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.PL, cs.SE. 

The paper discusses a state-of-the-art criterion for evaluating the importance of learned clauses in CDCL SAT solvers and proposes a new variable bumping scheme based on the appearance count of glue variables in learned clauses. This work involves techniques from artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) for improving SAT solving efficiency. It also involves data structures (DS) and algorithms for CDCL SAT solving. The paper presents experimental results and empirical evaluation, which are typical of research in the areas of machine learning (LG) and software engineering (SE).
